comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Actress Paula Hilburn Blackton (1881-1930): her husband James Stuart Blackton was founder of Vitagraph Studios, an early film studio. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paula_Blackton en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Stuart_Blackton www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=11517827 Paula Blackton was an enthusiastic yachtswoman, and owned a champion racing yacht. She made the news herself in 1911, when she jumped into Huntington Bay, Long Island, from the yacht Paula, "with all her wraps on," to save a waiter who had fallen out of his canoe. She also directed films, often starring her own children Violet and Charles, set at the family estate in Oyster Bay. In one of them (The Littlest Scout, 1919), her son is a Boy Scout who is kidnapped by German spies and leads a Scout troop to capture a German submarine.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca:  thank you for the additional information about this fascinating woman.  We will add more details when we update the description.
